info.title: Message Stores
info.description:
Message store enables you get data for processed messages. You can access the stored message and analyze it at a later point in time. An integration flow stores messages in a message store through the Persist step for 90 days.  
Additionally, you can get information on the JMS resources available on the tenant as well as on those actually used by your integration flows.  
This API is implemented based on OData version 2 specification.

externalDocs.description: SAP Cloud Integration documentation: OData API - Message Store

x-sap-shortText: Access message store entries, JMS resources and data store entries.

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration REST API Endpoint

Account Short Name.description: SAP BTP subaccount short name where Cloud Integration is provided

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration Custom Domain Endpoint - see [Configuring Custom Domains](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/7230b9ff41914cc0969223e6a020104b.html)

Custom Name.description: Your defined name for your Cloud Integration account.

get.description:
You can use the following request to get message store entries for the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries.
get.summary: Get message store entries by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

get.description:
You can use the following request to get entry from message store for a specific entry Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries.
get.summary: Get message store entry by Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryId
parameters.description: Message store entry Id

get.description:
You can use the following request to get message payload from message store for a specific entry Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries.
get.summary: Get message payload from message store by entry Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryId
parameters.description: Message store entry Id

200.description: Retrieved payload of message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get all attachments from the message store entry with specified entry Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and attachments.
get.summary: Get attachments from message store by entry Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryId
parameters.description: Message store entry Id

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the attachment of a message store entry with specified attachment Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and attachments.
get.summary: Get attachment from message store by attachment Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryAttachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id of the message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the attachment content of a message store entry with specified Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and attachments.
get.summary: Get attachment content from message store by attachment Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryAttachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id of a message store entry

200.description: Retrieved attachment content of message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get attachment properties of a message store entry for specified attachment Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and attachments.
get.summary: Get attachment properties from message store by attachment Id.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryAttachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id of a message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get attachment properties of a message store entry for specified attachment Id and property name.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and attachments.
get.summary: Get attachment properties from message store by attachment Id and property name.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryAttachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id of a message store entry

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Property name of the attachment for a message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get all properties of message store entry for the specified entry Id.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and properties.
get.summary: Get all properties of message store by entry Id

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryId
parameters.description: Message store entry Id

get.description:
You can use the following request to get property of message store entry for the specified entry Id and property name.
In API sandbox the integration flow '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' creates the corresponding message processing logs with message store entries and properties.
get.summary: Get property from message store by entry Id and property name.

parameters.name: MessageStoreEntryID
parameters.description: Message store entry Id

parameters.name: PropertyName
parameters.description: Property name for the message store entry

get.description:
You can use the following request to get information on the JMS resources available on the tenant as well as on those actually used by your integration flows.
Additional information about response values for some attributes: * __IsTransactedSessionsHigh__: __0__ - enough transactions available __1__ - number of transactions exceeding the allowed limit * __IsConsumerHigh__: __0__ - enough consumer available __1__ - number of consumers exceeding the allowed limits * __IsProducersHigh__: __0__ - enough producers available __1__ - number of producers exceeding the allowed limit
get.summary: Get available resources of JMS queues.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities.

200.description: Retrieved entity with expand on queue states

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the Number Range Objects available on the tenant.
There are two Number Ranges defined in API sandbox: '__NumberRange1__' and '__NumberRange2__'
get.summary: Get available Number Ranges.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add a Number Range Object.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update integration flows.

parameters.name: NumberRanges
parameters.description: Attribute-values of the new NumberRange Object
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the Number Range Object by a name.
There are two Number Ranges defined in API sandbox: '__NumberRange1__' and '__NumberRange2__'
get.summary: Get specific Number Range by it's name'.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Name of the Number Range object

put.description:
You can use the following request to update a Number Range Object.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update integration flows.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Name of the Number Range object

parameters.name: NumberRanges
parameters.description: New Attribute-values of the NumberRange Object. The Name must be the same as objectName in the path. You have to provide all attributes.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete a Number Range Object.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update integration flows.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Name of the Number Range object
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

get.description: You can use the following request to get the Data Stores available on the tenant.
get.summary: Get available Data Stores.

parameters.name: overdueonly
parameters.description: If this parameter is ```true``` only Data Stores with overdue messages are shown. If it is ```false``` or not available all Data Stores are shown.

get.description: You can use the following request to get the Data Store by a name.
get.summary: Get specific Data Store by it's name'.

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete a Data Store.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete Data Stores.

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

get.description: You can use the following request to get all Data Store entries available on the tenant.
get.summary: Get all Data Store entries.

parameters.name: overdueonly
parameters.description: If this parameter is ```true``` only Data Store entries with overdue messages are shown. If it is ```false``` or not available all Data Store entries are shown.

parameters.name: messageid
parameters.description: Shows all Data Store Entries with the mpl id

get.description: You can use the following request to get al Data Store entries for a specific Data Store available on the tenant.
get.summary: Get all Data Store entries for a specific Data Store.

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: overdueonly
parameters.description: If this parameter is ```true``` only Data Store entries with overdue messages are shown. If it is ```false``` or not available all Data Store entries are shown.

parameters.name: messageid
parameters.description: Shows all Data Store Entries with the mpl id

get.description: You can use the following request to get a Data Store entry.
get.summary: Get specific Data Store entry by it's Id'.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of the Data Store entry

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete a Data Store entry.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete Data Stores.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of the Data Store entry

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

get.description: You can use the following request to download a Data Store entry content.
get.summary: Download content of a specific Data Store entry by it's Id'.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of the Data Store entry

parameters.name: DataStoreName
parameters.description: Name of the Data Store

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: Is used for Data Stores that are created by Adapters (e.g. XI or AS4) or Flowsteps (e.g. Aggregator). Is empty if the visibility is Global or IntegrationFlow

get.description: You can use the following request to get all Variables entries available on the tenant.
get.summary: Get all Variables entries.

get.description: You can use the following request to get the Variable by a name.
get.summary: Get specific Variable by it's name'.

parameters.name: VariableName
parameters.description: Name of the Variable

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete a Variable.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete Variables.

parameters.name: VariableName
parameters.description: Name of the Variable

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

get.description: You can use the following request to get the content of a Variable by a name.
get.summary: Downlaod Variable's content by it's name'.

parameters.name: VariableName
parameters.description: Name of the Variable

parameters.name: IntegrationFlowId
parameters.description: The ID of the IntegrationFlow

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the CSRF token for this session, which is required for write access via POST, PUT and DELETE operations. Copy the received X-CSRF-Token from the response header.
**In API sandbox this request is not relevant!**
get.summary: Get CSRF token.

parameters.description: To retrieve a new CSRF token the value of the header must be set to ```Fetch```.
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: The header provides the CSRF token for this session.

X-CSRF-Token.description: CSRF token that can be used for all modifying requests within the same session.

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items.

400.description: Bad Request. Wrong format or structure of the provided request body or parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: Forbidden. The required permissions to access the resource are missing.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource could not be found.

429.description: Too many requests. Servers rate limit exceeded.

500.description: Internal server error. The requested operation led to an error during execution.
